holidays.name: Peculiar People Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate all the delightfully unusual, quirky, and eccentric people who make the world more interesting!
holidays.origin: The day was unofficially started by fans of quirky personalities, encouraging people to embrace their uniqueness.
holidays.funFact: Some peculiar people celebrate by dressing in mismatched clothes and sharing odd but fun stories.

holidays.name: Houseplant Appreciation Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to honoring and pampering your leafy green friends in your home.
holidays.origin: Began in the early 2000s as houseplants became popular for improving indoor air quality and aesthetics.
holidays.funFact: People often talk to their houseplants on this day, believing it helps them grow better!

holidays.name: National Bittersweet Chocolate Day
holidays.description: A delicious tribute to bittersweet chocolate lovers, reminding us to savor the perfect balance of sweet and bitter.
holidays.origin: Created by chocolate enthusiasts to celebrate the rich flavor of bittersweet chocolate in baking and treats.
holidays.funFact: Bittersweet chocolate contains at least 35% cocoa solids but is often enjoyed at 60% or higher for intense flavor.

holidays.name: Flower Sellers Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the hardworking flower vendors and florists who brighten lives with their beautiful bouquets.
holidays.origin: Honors the tradition of flower sellers dating back centuries in various cultures, especially in Europe.
holidays.funFact: In some countries, flower sellers would sing songs or chant to attract customers, turning selling into a performance.
